H0.text: Region is the collection of all populations of species in an area.

H1.text: A niche is the collective assemblage of all the populations of species in an area.

H2.text: Family is the taxonomic grouping that all of the populations of species in an area make up.

H3.text: Community is formed by all of the populations of species in an area.

A4.text: A community is a group or association of populations of two or more different species occupying the same geographical area at the same time.

A5.text: Within the community, each species occupies a niche.
